description: Conversion of existing residential property into six self-contained flats; construction of two storey side extension (following the demolition of existing garage and car port); single storey rear extensions (followingthe demolition of the exisitng single storey rear extensions); side and rear roof extensions, and front and side roof lights; a cycle store in rear garden.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) PDB/13/200/02B, PDB/13/200/05, PDB/13/200/06 and PDB/13/200/07 unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surrounding, in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policies 7.4 and 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policy 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policy 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2011). | Refuse storage shall be provided in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority.  Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the commencement of the development and retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), emerging policies 3.5 and 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (July 2011) policy 5.16. | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority (legal agreement) and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit (including visitors' permits) within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time. The professional and legal fees incurred by the Council in drafting and completing the agreement shall be met by the applicant/owner.  Reason: To ensure that the development is car-free and does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policy 6.13 of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 6.13 of the London Plan 2011. | A minimum of six (6) cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site in accordance with adopted standards of the London Plan 2011. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to first occupation and retained permanently.  Reason:	To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 9.6 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Core Strategy and policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2011. | Details shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, which will achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms, as specified in Supplementary Planning Guidance 10.  The details should also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation in accordance with Authority's criteria.  The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of occupants of the proposed residential units, and in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary  Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained within the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance note 10: 'Noise and Vibration', policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and London Plan (July 2011) policies 7.14, and 7.15. | The proposed stair way at the rear of the property shall be screened for the entire length of the stairs with a soild 1.8m high screen.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of proposed flats 1 and 2, in accordance with policy 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policy 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the adopted Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7.6 of the London Plan (2011).
